oai_dc:dc.dc:title: CCC Preparing a slope for seeding and planting.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of a team of CCC workmen preparing a slope near a road for planting trees. Such projects helped prevent erosion of bare slopes.

The Civilian Conservation Corps was created by Congress in 1937 to succeeed the Emergency Conservation Work program begun in 1933. Remedial education and vocational training programs were added later.; The mission of the CCC was to provide work for unemployed young people. The CCC built roads, homes, and furniture, and it was instrumental in the infrastructure of the Tennessee State Parks system and National Parks in Tennessee.
